results.abstract: Defense Dept repts retired Gen Andrew J Goodpaster will be reactivated to become acad supt, replacing Lt Gen Sidney B Berry; cites Goodpaster's 'extraordinary reputation' within Army; acad's recent cheating scandals recalled (M)

headline.main: Goodpaster Will Leave Retirement To Be West Point Superintendent; GOODPASTER, RETIRED, TO HEAD WEST POINT

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 4 The Defense Department announced today the recall from retirement of Gen. Andrew J. Good- paster to take over as superintendent of the United States Military Academy. The appointment comes at a time when the institution's...
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 4 The Defense Department announced today the recall from retirement of Gen. Andrew J. Good- paster to take over as superintendent of the United States Military Academy. The appointment comes at a time when the institution's reputation has been clouded by cheating scandals and internal friction.

results.abstract: ILA strikes 7 major shipping lines operating in NY Port; issues in strike discussed; Fed officials meet with union pres Thomas W Gleason in Washington (M)

headline.main: East Coast Dockers Go on Strike Against 7 Major Shipping Lines

results.snippet: East Coast longshoremen went on strike against seven major shipping lines this morning despite last-minuteefforts by Labor Department officials to avert the walkout.
results.lead_paragraph: East Coast longshoremen went on strike against seven major shipping lines this morning despite last-minuteefforts by Labor Department officials to avert the walkout.

results.abstract: Louisville, Ky, alarmed by presence of toxic chems, hexachlorocyclopentadiene and octachlorocylopentene, used in pesticide mfr, in its sewer system; fear Ohio River pollution; chems discovered Mar 29; are not mfd in Ky and it is not known how they got into system; city has closed down its sewage treatment plant since discovery; EPA Admr Jack Ravan comments; illus of EPA worker testing for chems (M)

headline.main: Louisville Fears Further Ill Effects From Toxic Chemicals in the Ohio; Chemicals May React to Heat Special Suits for Safety

results.snippet: LOUISVILLE, April 15--Normally, rising temperatures and a receding river at this time of year would be enthusiastically welcomed along the Ohio River, especially after the extremely harsh weather this winter.

byline.original: By PAUL DELANEY Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, April 15--Normally, rising temperatures and a receding river at this time of year would be enthusiastically welcomed along the Ohio River, especially after the extremely harsh weather this winter.

results.abstract: Travel article on US Mil Acad, West Point; map (L)

headline.main: For Visitors, West Point Is Always on Parade

results.snippet: IT WAS REVEILLE at West Point on July 4 last year, and one of the participants, Lieut. Col. John H.  Bradley, director of Bicentennial activities at the United States Military Academy, was preoccupied. He had noticed that a flag was already flying...
results.lead_paragraph: IT WAS REVEILLE at West Point on July 4 last year, and one of the participants, Lieut. Col. John H. Bradley, director of Bicentennial activities at the United States Military Academy, was preoccupied. He had noticed that a flag was already flying over Fort Putnam, a redoubt high above the Plains.
